page.title: 05Thoughts on sailing by I Jay
page.content: Sailing on the Exe,I just love it-it's one of the most relaxing & interesting things I do-many faceted,changing daily and seasonally.My 16ft dingy is kept in Lympstone harbour or on moorings and I take it out 3-4 times a week in summer when the weather is suitable-fine days in the winter are my ideal.The time to set sail is 2hrs each side of high tide when water reaches the end of the harbour wall,it is safe to sail anywhere in the estuary. A strong wind means plenty to do,but when conditions are calm,I can drift with the tide to Dawlish Warren, picnic,then wait for the turn to take me back.With Starcross pubs & the Turf Hotel(with resident seal)where Canal & Exe meet,what more do you need to see or do.
